name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. George BRITTON, Appellant
docket_number: Appeal No. 17 Eastern Dist. Appeal Docket, 1985

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDER-MOTT, HUTCHINSON, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
ZAPPALA, J., files a dissenting statement.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. George BRITTON, Appellant.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
ZAPPALA, J., files a dissenting statement.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

opinions.text:
ZAPPALA, Justice,
dissenting.
Not only would I reach the merits of this appeal, but I would reverse the Appellant’s conviction and grant him a new trial. It is clear from the record that the trial judge exceeded his proper duty by his extensive interrogation of the Appellant. Commonwealth v. Myma, 278 Pa. 505, 123 A. 486 (1924). See Commonwealth v. Britton, 334 Pa.Super. 203, 222, 482 A.2d 1294, 1304 (1984) (dissenting opinion of Spaeth, P.J.).
opinions.author: ZAPPALA, Justice,

attorneys: John W. Packel, Chief/Appeals Div., Asst. Public Defender, Jules Epstein, Philadelphia, for appellant.
Robert B. Lawler, Chief/Appeals Div., Eric B. Henson, Jane Cutler Greenspan, Asst. Dist. Attys., for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
506 A.2d 895
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. George BRITTON, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Oct. 25, 1985.
Decided March 31, 1986.
John W. Packel, Chief/Appeals Div., Asst. Public Defender, Jules Epstein, Philadelphia, for appellant.
Robert B. Lawler, Chief/Appeals Div., Eric B. Henson, Jane Cutler Greenspan, Asst. Dist. Attys., for appellee.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDER-MOTT, HUTCHINSON, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
